Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no specific definition or source provided to determine how "bad" Rhode Island is in terms of income equality.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Rhode Island is one of the worst states for income equality without providing sufficient evidence or comparing it to other states.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim could have alternative explanations as other sources and reports suggest that Rhode Island is not among the worst states for income inequality.
Understate: The claim may understate the income inequality in Rhode Island as it is ranked 13th or 17th out of 50 states in terms of income inequality, which is not among the worst.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Rhode Island is not among the top 10 worst states for income inequality, as indicated by various reports and data.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the severity of income inequality in Rhode Island by stating that it is one of the worst states, when it is actually ranked lower in comparison to other states.
